bio.name: Kalle Mäkelä
bio.description: I'm a Ph.D. student building machine learning systems that decode brain activity from fNIRS signals. My work bridges signal processing, neural networks, and brain-computer interfaces, with a side hobby of making code that is actually usable by others.

items.title: NEMO: A Database for Emotion Analysis Using Functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy
items.subtitle: IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing | 2024 | Journal article
description: Michiel Spapé, Kalle Mäkelä, Tuukka Ruotsalo

items.title: mne-bids PR #1466
items.description: Handle channel name mismatches between raw data and BIDS channels.tsv

items.title: Machine Learning Approaches to fNIRS-Based Emotion Recognition
items.subtitle: M.Sc. thesis
items.description: Compares deep learning and classical ML for fNIRS-based emotion recognition, with thorough cross-validation and hyperparameter selection for noisy low-signal data. Supervisor: Stephane Deny. Advisor: Tuukka Ruotsalo.

items.title: Diffusion Planning
items.description: Using diffusion models to create plans in RL grid-world environments given the initial state and a natural language instruction, such as 'move the ball to the circle'. Diffusion is much faster than decision-transformers since it's not autoregressive, with slightly worse performance.

items.title: Crowdsourcing Affective Annotations Via fNIRS-BCI
items.subtitle: IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing | 2024-01 | Journal article
description: Tuukka Ruotsalo, Kalle Mäkelä, Michiel Spapé

items.title: Joplin PR #13675, PR #14363
items.description: Make mobile editor remember editing mode between sessions. Most of the changes are in the first PR, second PR has squahed first PR commits and added minor improvements.

items.title: Affective Relevance: Inferring Emotional Responses via fNIRS Neuroimaging
items.subtitle: 2023-07-19 | Conference paper
description: Tuukka Ruotsalo, Kalle Mäkelä, Michiel M. Spapé, Luis A. Leiva

items.title: Feeling Positive? Predicting Emotional Image Similarity from Brain Signals
items.subtitle: 2023-10-26 | Conference paper
description: Tuukka Ruotsalo, Kalle Mäkelä, Michiel M. Spapé, Luis A. Leiva

items.title: Causal Reasoning in Reinforcement Learning
items.description: B.Sc. thesis project on using causal reasoning to improve reinforcement learning methods. Mostly theoretical work on multi-armed bandits.

items.title: fastfnirs
items.description: Very high-level package for parsing, preprocessing, visualizing and classifying fNIRS data.

items.title: REINFORCE vs PPO from Scratch
items.description: PPO and REINFORCE implementations without RL libraries.

items.title: Visualizing RL Loss Functions
items.description: Building visual intuition for complex RL loss functions, e.g. PPO with many variables and clipping.

items.title: Kullback-Leibler Divergence Visualization
items.description: Kullback-Leibler Divergence visualization with how much each point contributes to the divergence.

items.title: More Informative Group Relative Advantage Losses
items.description: Research on improving Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) by extracting more value from the reward distribution across multiple policy runs. Experiments compare performance to GRPO and PPO in simple environments, showing promising proof-of-concept results.

items.title: Feedbacker-Forum
items.description: Feedbacker-Forum deploys (almost) any web application via docker, while injecting an interactive interface on top of the application for collecting feedback from designers. Support selecting DOM elements, creating quizzes, fast css modifications etc.

items.title: GNN Sudoku solver
items.description: A Sudoku solver implemented using a Graph Neural Network based on Recurrent Relational Networks (Palm et al., 2018).

items.title: unogs
items.description: Browser extension for unogs.com that adds watched titles tracking and watchlist functionality

items.title: jopvim
items.description: Joplin plugin for nvim with basic CRUD operations + automatic quick-note categorization and tagging via ollama text embedding + KNN.

items.title: Nested Cross-Val-Test for Scikit-learn & PyTorch Lightning
items.description: Performs nested cross-val-test evaluation for any Scikit-learn or PyTorch Lightning model.

items.title: MTS to MP4 Converter
items.description: Automatic bulk MTS to MP4 Converter.

items.title: Contrastive learning embedding classification experiment
items.description: A contrastive learning experiment using triplet loss to learn embeddings from MNIST data, t-SNE visualization and embedding classification with classic ML methods.

items.title: Ensembling from CV folds
items.description: Instead of refitting on entire train set after cross-validation, we use the already fitted models as an ensemble for test time prediction.

items.title: Iterative Behaviour Cloning
items.description: Collect data, filter rollouts based on a condition, train a model on the filtered data, repeat. Funny baseline method for RL experiments that works surprisingly well.

items.title: Behavioral Cloning Experiments
items.description: Compares pure behavioral cloning (BC), behavioral cloning with critic pretraining (CAC), and PPO baseline on the CarRacing-v3 environment. Includes class activation maps and ablations on frame stacking.

items.title: Perception loss VAE
items.description: Large scale image VAE with reconstruction and perception loss.

items.title: subsampling_significance_tests
items.description: Implementation and analysis of statistical tests for comparing the performance of machine learning models using resampling methods, such as repeated cross-validation.

items.title: Mobile PDF Reflow Viewer
items.description: Simple pdf reflow tool for reading PDFs on mobile without acrobat reader.

items.title: Subsampling CIs
items.description: Research on subsampling bootstrap methods for constructing confidence intervals, comparing standard bootstrap with subsampling and MOON (M-out-of-N) bootstrap. Also testing a bias correction method for subsampling.

items.title: Classification Bad Examples
items.description: Shows how small datasets + noisy data + LOO-CV can lead to unexpected information leakage even with valid train-test splits.

items.title: Custom CV
items.description: Additional cross-validation iterators for scikit-learn. Useful for group CV that require a lot of folds and repetitions due to high variance in validation and test scores (usually due to small dataset size).

items.title: SKUtils
items.description: Additional scikit-learn utilities. Includes e.g. StandardScalerND, which extends scikit-learn StandardScaler to work on multi-dimensional data, enabling easy DL model integration with scikit-learn Pipeline.

items.title: Multi-output Training
items.description: Generate multiple unique outputs per sample via dropout, compute loss for each, and average. Tests whether this is more sample-efficient than standard single-output training.

items.title: Conservative Q-Learning (CQL)
items.description: Experiments testing how network parameters and state-visit frequency affect conservative Q-values.

items.title: Finnish Scrabble Helper
items.description: Finds valid Finnish scrabble words for a given set of letters and jokers.

items.title: Scrabble Timer
items.description: Chess-clock-style timer for scrabble where taking longer reduces your points.

items.title: Junction 2019
items.description: Hackathon project for managing construction sites.
